attachments.title: Understanding the Bias-Variance Tradeoff
attachments.text: When we discuss prediction models, prediction errors can be decomposed into two main subcomponents we care about: error due to bias and error due to variance. There is a tradeoff between a model's ability to minimize bias and variance. Understanding these two types of error can help us diagnose model results and avoid the mistake of over- or under-fitting.
